intro: Micranthes furumii, commonly known as the dwarf meadow saxifrage, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The plant typically features rosettes of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers with five petals. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
